Class Paddle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Paddle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Paddle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Paddle is the class that will move the user-controlled paddle around the screen
    Version:
    CS56, Spring 2013, UCSB
    Author:
    Timothy Fok, Bhanu Khanijau, Sanchit Gupta

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.Integer paddleHeight 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Paddle(int x, int y)
      Paddle contructor to initialize intial x,y placement of paddle

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      draw the paddle onto the screen as a rectangle
      int getdy()
      return the dy of the paddle
      int getPaddleBotHit()
      returns the Ypos2 of the paddle, which is the lowest point the paddle can go to.
      int getPaddleTopHit()
      returns the Ypos of the paddle, which is the top of the screen where the paddle can highest go to
      int getXpos()
      returns the X position of the paddle
      int getYpos()
      returns the Y position of the paddle
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
      KeyPressed handles what to do if player hits up or down key.
      void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
      KeyReleased handles what to do if player releaseds up or down key.
      void movePaddleLeft()
      move handles the changing position of the paddle, keeps the paddle from going offscreen.
      void run()
      runs the paddle thread and starts animating it.
      void setdy(int newdy)
      set the speed of the change of y position
      void setPaddleHeight(int newHeight)
      set the height of the paddle
      void setYpos(int newY)
      set the speed of the change of x position

    • Constructor Detail

      • Paddle

        public Paddle(int x,
      int y)
        Paddle contructor to initialize intial x,y placement of paddle
        Parameters:
        x - sets the x position of the paddle.
        y - sets the y position of the paddle.

    • Method Detail

      • setPaddleHeight

        public void setPaddleHeight(int newHeight)
        set the height of the paddle
        Parameters:
        newHeight - chooses the new height for the paddle

      • run

        public void run()
        runs the paddle thread and starts animating it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
        KeyPressed handles what to do if player hits up or down key. Paddle should move up upon up key and down upon down key.
        Parameters:
        e - finds which key on the keyboard was hit.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent evt)
        KeyReleased handles what to do if player releaseds up or down key. Paddle should stop upon key release.
        Parameters:
        e - finds which key on the keyboard was released.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        draw the paddle onto the screen as a rectangle
        Parameters:
        g - graphics handles the drawing of the paddle

      • setdy

        public void setdy(int newdy)
        set the speed of the change of y position
        Parameters:
        newdy - chooses the new speed

      • getdy

        public int getdy()
        return the dy of the paddle

      • setYpos

        public void setYpos(int newY)
        set the speed of the change of x position
        Parameters:
        newdx - chooses the new speed

      • getYpos

        public int getYpos()
        returns the Y position of the paddle

      • getXpos

        public int getXpos()
        returns the X position of the paddle

      • getPaddleTopHit

        public int getPaddleTopHit()
        returns the Ypos of the paddle, which is the top of the screen where the paddle can highest go to

      • getPaddleBotHit

        public int getPaddleBotHit()
        returns the Ypos2 of the paddle, which is the lowest point the paddle can go to.

      • movePaddleLeft

        public void movePaddleLeft()
        move handles the changing position of the paddle, keeps the paddle from going offscreen.
